description.zh-cn: 中国左翼作家、政治人物，长期负责中共情报工作，中华人民共和国成立后曾任上海市副市长。1955年因内奸罪被捕，1982年获得平反。
description.en: Chinese left-wing writer and politician who was in charge of the CCP's intelligence work for a long time. He served as the deputy mayor of Shanghai after the founding of the People's Republic of China. He was arrested in 1955 on charges of being a traitor and was rehabilitated in 1982.

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年之父，曾开办私塾，一度被选为宜兴县议员。
description.en: Father of Pan Hannian, who ran a private school and was once elected as a member of the Yixing County Council.

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年的配偶。
description.en: Spouse of Pan Hannian.

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年的大哥。
description.en: Pan Hannian's eldest brother.

description.zh-cn: 中国的执政党。
description.en: The ruling political party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党、中华人民共和国、中国人民解放军的主要缔造者和领导人。
description.en: The main founder and leader of the Communist Party of China, the People's Republic of China, and the People's Liberation Army.

description.zh-cn: 由毛泽东发动和领导的政治运动。
description.en: A political movement initiated and led by Mao Zedong.

nodes.id: 中国共产党中央委员会

zh-cn: 中国共产党中央委员会
en: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的中央权力机关。
description.en: The central authority of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期领导人之一。
description.en: One of the early leaders of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党早期青年运动领导人之一。
description.en: One of the early leaders of the youth movement of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国现代文学家、历史学家、社会活动家。
description.en: Chinese modern writer, historian, and social activist.

description.zh-cn: 1930年代在中国共产党领导下的文学组织。
description.en: A literary organization in the 1930s under the leadership of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党情报工作者，同时拥有中共、军统、中统、日军、汪精卫政府等五重间谍身份。
description.en: An intelligence agent of the Communist Party of China, who held five-fold spy identities for the CPC, Juntong, Zhongtong, the Japanese military, and the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 日本外交官，二战期间担任日本驻上海总领事馆副领事，负责情报工作，设立“岩井公馆”。
description.en: Japanese diplomat who served as the vice-consul at the Japanese Consulate-General in Shanghai during World War II, responsible for intelligence work and establishing the 'Iwai Mansion'.

description.zh-cn: 由岩井英一设立，专门搜集重庆国民政府及英美情报的日本特务单位。
description.en: A Japanese intelligence unit established by Iwai Eiichi, dedicated to collecting intelligence on the Chongqing National Government, Britain, and the United States.

description.zh-cn: 汪精卫政权特务机构“76号”的负责人。
description.en: The head of 'No. 76', the secret service agency of the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党高级领导人，后因“高饶反党联盟”事件被打倒。
description.en: A senior leader of the Communist Party of China, who was later purged in the 'Gao-Rao Anti-Party Alliance' incident.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争期间由汪精卫等人建立的亲日本政府。
description.en: A pro-Japanese government established by Wang Jingwei and others during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中共早期党员，后叛变，在汪精卫政权特务总部工作，是潘汉年会见汪精卫的唯一见证人。
description.en: An early member of the CPC who later defected and worked for the secret service headquarters of the Wang Jingwei regime. He was the sole witness to the meeting between Pan Hannian and Wang Jingwei.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国十大元帅之一，曾任上海市市长、国务院副总理兼外交部长。
description.en: One of the Ten Marshals of the People's Republic of China, who served as Mayor of Shanghai and Vice Premier and Foreign Minister of the State Council.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国开国大将，曾任公安部部长、解放军总参谋长。
description.en: A founding General of the People's Republic of China, who served as Minister of Public Security and Chief of the PLA General Staff.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党情报和特务工作的主要负责人之一，被誉为“特工之王”。
description.en: One of the main leaders of the intelligence and secret service work of the Communist Party of China, known as the 'King of Spies'.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国首任国务院总理。
description.en: The first Premier of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东的第四任妻子，“四人帮”成员之一。
description.en: Mao Zedong's fourth wife and a member of the 'Gang of Four'.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和中华人民共和国的主要领导人之一，以“八大元老”之一而闻名。
description.en: A major leader of the Communist Party of China and the People's Republic of China, known as one of the 'Eight Elders'.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党和国家领导人，长期负责中共的对外联络、统战、侨务、港澳等工作。
description.en: A leader of the CPC and the state, long responsible for the CPC's external liaison, united front work, overseas Chinese affairs, and Hong Kong and Macao affairs.

description.zh-cn: 曾任中共中央主席和中共中央总书记。
description.en: Served as Chairman of the CPC Central Committee and General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年是潘莘臣的儿子。
description.en: Pan Hannian is the son of Pan Xinchen.

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年是董慧的配偶。
description.en: Pan Hannian is the spouse of Dong Hui.

description.zh-cn: 潘梓年是潘汉年的大哥。
description.en: Pan Zinian is Pan Hannian's elder brother.

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年于1925年11月加入中国共产党。
description.en: Pan Hannian joined the Communist Party of China in November 1925.

position.en: Secretary of the CPC Party Group

description.zh-cn: 潘汉年担任中国左翼作家联盟（左联）的中共党组书记。
description.en: Pan Hannian served as the Secretary of the CPC Party Group of the League of Left-Wing Writers.

description.zh-cn: 秦邦宪（博古）邀请潘汉年参与孙中山追悼会的筹备工作，并将其介绍给恽代英，为潘汉年开启了革命生涯。
description.en: Qin Bangxian (Bo Gu) invited Pan Hannian to participate in the preparation of Sun Yat-sen's memorial service and introduced him to Yun Daiying, which started Pan's revolutionary career.

description.zh-cn: 建议潘汉年去上海工作，促使其进入更广阔的革命活动舞台。
description.en: Suggested that Pan Hannian go to Shanghai to work, prompting him to enter a broader stage of revolutionary activities.

description.zh-cn: 邀请潘汉年赴南昌编辑《革命军日报》，使其在国民革命军总政治部担任职务。
description.en: Invited Pan Hannian to Nanchang to edit the 'Revolutionary Army Daily', leading to his position in the General Political Department of the National Revolutionary Army.

description.zh-cn: 介绍袁殊加入中国共产党，袁殊后成为其重要的情报人员。
description.en: Introduced Yuan Shu to join the Communist Party of China; Yuan later became his key intelligence operative.

description.zh-cn: 同意潘汉年与汪精卫政权特务头子李士群进行接触。
description.en: Approved Pan Hannian's contact with Li Shiqun, the head of the secret service of the Wang Jingwei regime.

description.zh-cn: 在袁殊引荐下与日本驻上海领事馆情报官员岩井英一会面，并同意为其搜集英美、国军方面的情报。
description.en: Met with Iwai Eiichi, an intelligence officer at the Japanese Consulate in Shanghai, through Yuan Shu's introduction, and agreed to collect intelligence on British, American, and Nationalist forces for him.

description.zh-cn: 与汪精卫政权特务头子李士群建立联系并展开情报合作，曾住进其私人寓所。
description.en: Established contact with Li Shiqun, head of the Wang Jingwei regime's secret service, for intelligence cooperation, and once lived in his private residence.

description.zh-cn: 在李士群的安排下与汪精卫会面。潘汉年此事对中共中央隐瞒长达十二年，成为其后来被判内奸罪的重要依据。
description.en: Met with Wang Jingwei, arranged by Li Shiqun. Pan Hannian concealed this meeting from the CPC Central Committee for twelve years, which became a key piece of evidence in his later conviction as a traitor.

description.zh-cn: 安排了潘汉年与汪精卫的会面。
description.en: Arranged the meeting between Pan Hannian and Wang Jingwei.

description.zh-cn: 在潘汉年向其坦白曾会见汪精卫后，将此事转呈给毛泽东，直接导致了潘汉年的被捕。
description.en: After Pan Hannian confessed to him about meeting Wang Jingwei, he reported the matter to Mao Zedong, which directly led to Pan's arrest.

description.zh-cn: 在收到陈毅转呈的潘汉年报告后，批示“此人从此不可信用”，并手谕“立即逮捕审查潘汉年”，将其定性为内奸并导致其被长期监禁。
description.en: After receiving Pan Hannian's report forwarded by Chen Yi, Mao Zedong wrote the directive 'This person is henceforth not to be trusted' and ordered 'Immediately arrest and investigate Pan Hannian,' labeling him a traitor and leading to his long-term imprisonment.

description.zh-cn: 时任公安部部长，根据毛泽东的指示，在北京饭店亲自秘密逮捕了潘汉年。
description.en: As the Minister of Public Security at the time, he personally and secretly arrested Pan Hannian at the Beijing Hotel under Mao Zedong's instructions.

description.zh-cn: 在潘汉年被捕后，向中共中央政治局和书记处报告，从情报工作的角度反驳了潘汉年的内奸嫌疑。
description.en: After Pan Hannian's arrest, he reported to the Politburo and Secretariat of the CPC Central Committee, refuting the suspicion of Pan being a traitor from an intelligence work perspective.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，指控潘汉年等人为反革命集团，导致潘汉年被重新收监并被判处无期徒刑。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, she accused Pan Hannian and others of being a counter-revolutionary clique, leading to Pan's re-imprisonment and a life sentence.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命开始后，潘汉年被重新收监，并最终被判处无期徒刑，永久开除党籍。
description.en: After the start of the Cultural Revolution, Pan Hannian was re-imprisoned, and eventually sentenced to life imprisonment and permanently expelled from the party.

description.zh-cn: 作为1936年国共谈判的知情者，在文革后负责平反冤假错案期间，着手联系当事人并组织材料，启动并大力推动了为潘汉年平反昭雪的进程。
description.en: As an insider to the 1936 KMT-CPC negotiations, he initiated and vigorously promoted the process of rehabilitating Pan Hannian while in charge of redressing unjust cases after the Cultural Revolution, by contacting relevant parties and organizing materials.

description.zh-cn: 公开表示应当为潘汉年平反，并向陈云写信阐明观点，对案件的复查起到了推动作用。
description.en: Publicly stated that Pan Hannian should be rehabilitated and wrote to Chen Yun to clarify his views, which helped promote the review of the case.

description.zh-cn: 在收到陈云转交的信件后，同意并支持了对潘汉年案的复查工作。
description.en: After receiving the letter forwarded by Chen Yun, he agreed to and supported the review of Pan Hannian's case.

relationships.source: 中国共产党中央委员会

description.zh-cn: 正式发出《关于为潘汉年同志平反昭雪恢复名誉的通知》，为其公开恢复名誉，推翻了所有不实之词。
description.en: Officially issued the 'Notice on the Rehabilitation and Restoration of Comrade Pan Hannian's Reputation,' publicly clearing his name and overturning all false accusations.
